dt: {bc}a life breath or vital principle in Vedic and later Hindu religion

dt.t: It's glorious to be in this newbie micro farm, with everything so green and lush and bursting with {wi}prana{/wi}.

Eastern philosophy holds that yoga heals by releasing {wi}prana{/wi}, the body's vital energy. When {wi}prana{/wi} is blocked, illness can result. Western practitioners believe yoga's deeply relaxing breath work allows the body's healing abilities to take over.

et: borrowed from Sanskrit {it}prāṇa-{/it} "breath, exhalation, breath of life," derivative from the base of {it}prāṇiti{/it} "(she/he) breathes, draws in breath," from {it}pra-{/it} "before, forward" + {it}aniti{/it} "(she/he) breathes" {ma}{mat|for:1|}, {mat|animate:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a life breath or vital principle in Vedic and later Hindu religion
